Rating: Not recommended for children under 12 years


Synopsis:
The year is 1215. King John of England (Paul Giamatti) has been forced to sign the Magna Carta. Furious, he recruits an army of ruthless mercenaries to lay waste the country begins to restore the absolute monarchy. Just a group of gentlemen gathered by Baron Albany (Brian Cox) and entrenched in the castle of Rochester stands between him and victory. With them, Marshall (James Purefoy), a Knight Templar tormented by guilt at the atrocities committed during the crusades, and mercenaries found among Beckett (Jason Flemyng) and the young Guy (Aneurin Barnard). In the midst of battle, Marshall must also deal with their burgeoning feelings for Isabel (Kate Mara), the beautiful lady of the castle and the wife of Reginald de Cornhill (Derek Jacobi).

Production notes:
Set in the dark and brutal thirteenth century, "TEMPLAR" is a story of honor and great action that reflects the raw truth of medieval warfare. The movie depicts a crucial moment in English history, when following the signing of the Magna Carta a group of Knights Templar led by Marshall (James Purefoy) fought to defend their country from the tyrannical John of England ("John Lackland" played by Paul Giamatti).
